website_summaries.verdict: If your goal is to trap mosquitoes, this model is the most effective when it comes to targeting the pest.
pros: Offers an enhanced illumination system that attracts more mosquitoes than other traps by the brand
Impressive 1 acre range of protection with spacious catch cage
cons: Big and heavy, and falls on the higher end of the price range
A few fan and bulb issues have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely huuuuge waste of money!!!! Thing is they say money back garanteed but thing is they do something deceiving. You buy this because you need it and trust them saying you’ll get your money back. And you try it and wait for the “at least 6 weeks to see the difference” as they say in the presentation of the product. And after 6 weeks when you finally decide to return the darn thing because its not doing what’s suppose to do, you realise that you cannot because the returning period is 30 days. NOT COOL!!!! So....BIG WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This trap has been catching a lot of mosquitos and moths. Leave it plugged in all the time and your trap starts filling. I personally love to reduce the mosquito population. I had an issue with my first one where the fan motor stopped working after 2 days. I called the company and once they confirmed that the light was on and the fan was off, they immediately shipped a new unit to me at no charge. My second unit is working perfectly for over a month now.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Sanfilippo

customer_reviews.title: I have mixed feelings about this unit. It traps ...
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this unit. It traps more moths than mosquitos, but the pesty mosquitos have seemed to die down in population after the initial rainy part of the summer. I still can't attribute whether this machine did it or because it has been so dry, but it does catch many insects. It beats having to fill up propane every month and electricity is cheap. This unit consumes a very low current so running it 24/7 all the time is a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Mosquitoes? NO  ---  Moths?  YOU BET
customer_reviews.text: I really, REALLY wanted this product to work. We have a serious mosquito problem at our lake home in NW Indiana. We have tried other "zappers" and other products with poor results but, out of desperation, gave DynaTrap a try. Sadly, after following the instructions and leaving the DynaTrap on for a solid three weeks, the only mosquitoes we saw were the ones biting us. If you are interested in catching miller moths and various other flying bugs.....well, perhaps DynaTrap is for you. Amazon (UPS) showed up today to pick up and return a totally ineffective product for stopping mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: JohnT

customer_reviews.title: Belongs in trash can. See photo
customer_reviews.text: This is where the Dynatrap belongs. In a trash can. What a piece of junk. I have had it up since April and still getting chewed by mosquitoes. Done everything the company said to do. No luck. Killed a ton of moths, but who gets bitten by a moth. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave and Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Had it for months, and this purchase was a complete waste of money. It's caught a ton of moths, but it has caught very limited if any mosquitos or flies. Maybe you need to add an "attractant" to make it better, but I'd assume that would have been part of the purchase. It does make for a cool black light in the backyard, but other than it fits well into our Halloween theme, it's worthless.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Green

customer_reviews.title: I should’ve believed bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: It caught lots and lots of moths, but very few mosquitoes. I looked up the how to use video and read instructions. It was quiet but did NOT do the job needed. Maybe got rid of mosquitoes by 10% but nothing near what was expected. I couldn’t return so now I am stuck with a useless machine.
customer_reviews.author: BusinessStudent

customer_reviews.title: This product really works and is silent. We live ...
customer_reviews.text: This product really works and is silent. We live on a golf course in Nevada and get lots of flying insects. Now with Dynatrap we can spend more time outdoors. Now our neighbors want to get one too.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT help
customer_reviews.text: I had great hope for the DynaTrap as we don’t even go outside in the summers due to the mosquitos. We have a pretty small yard so I figured if it covered an acre, we would be more than safe. We’ve had it up for 2 months now and it hasn’t helped or slowed down the mosquito biting. It does capture some but there are more moths than anything. It seems to he just a waste of electricity at this point. I just went outside for 3 minutes and got over 10 bites within that period. I would not recommend this product and if I could return it, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Poe

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Works great until it doesn't. It seemed to work well for a couple of months then not so much. I replaced the bulb with little or no improvement. Follow up: I have purchased this item in both the 1/2 acre and 1 acre size. They have both performed the same way. Great at first then steadily diminishing until all they catch is moths. After replacing the bulb they never reduced the mosquitos in my 1/2 acre yard. I have since turned the devices into bird feeders. If you buy one of these plan on replacing it every 2-3 months as that's how long they last. Changing the bulb does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: bkkrdd

customer_reviews.title: Ours arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Ours arrived broken, and it was really easy to return and get our money back. We already had a slightly different model from DynaTrap, and just wanted another to better cover our 1/2 acre yard. In the meantime, we found Biogents. Biogent traps work *exceptionally* well, and that's what we're now using. We definitely catch way more mosquitoes in the Biogents, and *only* mosquitos. The DynaTrap catches more moths for us than mosquitos. We've also had problems with the UV lights burning out early, so that's been a total bummer for us with the DynaTraps. Since the last UV light burnt out, I've just stopped running the DynaTrap.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fraley

customer_reviews.title: This product really works
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that YOU MUST READ THE INSTRUCTIONS MANUAL BEFORE using this product. if you follow the directions you will find that this machine actually works. We have a lot of mosquitoes in our area and the Dynatrap has really helped to reduce the population. We actually have a couple of Dynatraps and we have seen a significant difference. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Manning

customer_reviews.title: it's huge!
customer_reviews.text: Pictures make it look small, if you need to cover a 11k sq feet property, you shall use a smaller model that can be hanged on a hook or a tree branch. This beast is big, bright and mean to mosquitoes. Although the Houston specimens are crafty beasts that once in a while avoid being trapped.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandr N.

customer_reviews.title: No good for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work just fine at catching moths and most other flying insects, but if you want it to help control mosquitoes you're out of luck. I had this up all spring (all April & May) when the mosquitoes are thick in my neighborhood and when I'd clean out the tray there were virtually no mosquitoes inside, but I was being eaten alive by mosquitoes that were all over my yard. The only mosquitoes that it catches are more by accident than by design.
customer_reviews.author: Linda U.

customer_reviews.title: It worked (works), but it's big.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 1 acre one just because I really wanted to see results for the money I was spending. It really seems to be working. I have had it running for about 7 weeks now and mosquitoes are almost non-existent compared to when I decided to break down and order this. I just wish there was some trap door built into this so the device doesn't need to be running 24/7 to work. It's also very large because I got the 1 acre model. I hope this lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: @RickNakama

customer_reviews.title: Very effective but with limitations
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job if you put out in the open where it can attract from a large grassy area. Not so great at reducing the population in an area on the opposite size of the house. It says 1 acre but really only if it is within line of sight + a little bit. I may have to get another one for the other side of the house. On the bright side, my neighbors are very happy because it has reduced their mosquito population as well. Now I just need to get everyone on the block to get one and their won't be any mosquitos at all.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Null

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: Oh my god buy this. Absolutely amazing. Last year I couldn’t go outside in my yard any time after 4pm from May until October, the mosquitos were so bad. Me and my daughter got eaten alive, totally ruined our backyard summer experience. This year, I’m not exaggerating, I can go outside at dusk with no spray on and I don’t have a bite on me. I’m on 3/4 acre, and the entire backyard is mosquito free. My pollinators don’t seem attracted, so bonus there. Can not recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This one works!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this "on" since March 2018 when it arrived. Placed about 30' from my patio next to a tree. You might see one mosquito in an evening, but can easily sit outside. June is here and I have noticed hardly any issues with pests on the patio, even with the large amounts of rain we have had. I have a little over 1/2 acre, so this one seemed appropriate as I wanted to cover my back yard and surrounding areas. This ONLY works in line of site for pests.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: 26 W replacement bulb not available
customer_reviews.text: This itself is a great product it did the job for three months. No mosquitoes no bug snow flies. The problem is you can’t get the replacement bulb at 26 Watt. I got the 7 Watt but it does absolutely nothing. I have a big backyard and a lot of greenery. The 26 watt is supposed to be for 2 acres and works great, it came with the Dynotrap . Cannot find a 26 watt anywhere. So what good is the product without a decent Bulb to go with it? Paying $150 for a unit that works for three months is not good, in my opinion .
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kills moths
customer_reviews.text: This has been running steady for weeks & we are still getting eaten alive. The trap attracts more moths than mosquitoes. Maybe if it was hanging over the table it would work but for the price & the square feet that it claims to cover, this isn’t worth it.
customer_reviews.author: GS Glinsky

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: This has saved my flying swatting days inside. Yes, I only use it indoors. I have had it for more than a year. No flies, moths or plant nagging bugs anymore. No more yelling at folks to hurry and close the door before I even greet them. Absolutely, I have a thing about dirty indoor flying nuisances. I have counter top version for the bedroom too. I sleep undisturbed.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work much at all. I had it on for 3 straight weeks and only caught a few dozen mosquitoes and other bugs. It may be due to the fact that I’m near water and have a heavy sea breeze. Nonetheless, didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. Catches mainly beetles and moths. Bulb stopped working in 7 weeks. USELESS !
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes. However, it does not work. Catches mainly beetles and moths and very little else. Bulb stopped working in less than 2 months. Customer service is non existent ! I have tried it for about 7 weeks and it's totally USELESS ! Get a skeetervac as they actually work. My skeeter vac has lasted more than 10 years and still catches flys, mosquitoes, etc. I got this to try and supplement it, but the dynatrap is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Shupack

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Ballast going bad
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months the bulb quit. That's fine because you are supposed to change it about every 3 months. We ordered 2 new bulbs, neither one worked. After doing research we decided the ballast might be bad. Ordered a new ballast, the bulb lit for a second then went out. We disconnected the wires to the fan to test the ballast with the same results...bulb lit for a second and went out. We have no idea if the ballast we got was bad or what. Too bad this expensive item which was WONDERFUL while it worked, only lasted 4 months. And the warranty was only 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly P. Fessler

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend it. After we had ours for a few ...
customer_reviews.text: We live near a bay, so we have lots of mosquitoes. The Dynatrap has made a very noticeable difference in how many are in our yard! It definitely works. The only drawback is emptying it. All of the bugs aren't dead, and tend to fly up in your face when you take the cage off the bottom, which is kind of gross. But it does catch lots of mosquitoes and other flying creatures! I'd recommend it. After we had ours for a few weeks, we bought each of our married kids one, and they have reported good results, also.
customer_reviews.author: kmj

customer_reviews.title: Product Designers Should be Fired
customer_reviews.text: The designers of this product should be locked in a room with one million mosquitoes while they are changing the light bulb. You have to disassemble the entire unit just to change the light bulb. And it does not reassemble easily. The screws are too short so I had to find different ones. One (1) hour to change a light bulb. I recommend that you look at the upgraded model with the external light bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Works well...When you can find bulbs...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product about 4 months ago. The amount of beetles, moths, etc. it caught was amazing! Unfortunately the bulb died right on queue (about 4 months) and the pests have increased. We can't find a bulb at ANY online retailer. I called the company and they recommended searching on google for "43050 bulb". Same issue. Nobody has them in stock and from what I've gleaned from several retailers, the manufacturer is extremely behind in production. Who knows when they will be back in stock and at this point, it serves as a glorified lawn ornament...
customer_reviews.author: Francis I.

customer_reviews.title: Bulb needs to be changed yearly in the four seasons part of the country and changing it is a pain you have to take the unit apart which is the easy part, putting it back together is another
customer_reviews.text: Traps a lot of bugs, some mosquitos but a lot of moths and other flying insects. Mainly bought for mosquitos and seems to be keeping the yard clear of them so far. Bulb needs to be changed yearly in the four seasons part of the country and changing it is a pain you have to take the unit apart which is the easy part, putting it back together is another story
customer_reviews.author: Average Guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for moths, but not much for other bugs.
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best trap for moths of all sizes. My bug zapper was not able to get the large moths because they couldn't get to the grid. They can get inside this one. The praying mantids were waiting on the outside to grab the buffet meal. The only disappointment was that I didn't find one stink bug, mosquito, or other tiny flying insects in there.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This is incredible! I would estimate after using the trap for only 24 hours that there were over a thousand bugs of all kinds in the trap. After three days they are really piling up. It is just so incredible to actually see how many bugs are no longer infesting our deck in the evening. Truly amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Working great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to longevity has have only had this a couple weeks, but it's very effective. If you don't like to catch and kill moths and beetles you can empty daily as I found mosquitoes dessicate and die quicky and the other insects survive. The video below is from 2 nights, yes a single weekend catch in Iowa.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This attracts every bug for a large area (I guess), BUT - It is difficult to empty. It is HUGE, wish I had gotten to smaller one. Can't tell if it is getting mosquitos because they are so tiny; however, it is getting lots of other bugs that don't necessarily bother me. So, in all, very disappointed. Big price, little return.
customer_reviews.author: Art Queen

customer_reviews.title: Avoid buying this.  Light bulb failed.. No support from Amazon or Dynatrap
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for 33 days. Light bulb quit working THREE days after the return window closed. Bulb advertised to last 3+ months ( Enough for the summer). Failed after 33 days!!!. Mosquitoes returned with a vengeance. No response from Amazon or seller. Replacement bulbs are non existent across the internet. I am extremely disappointed with both Amazon and Dynatrap. Stand behind your product and you would get a 5 star review from me.
customer_reviews.author: Seamus

customer_reviews.title: Safe around children & Pets Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a pine forrest & have bad mosquito problem This Dyna trap is replacing a half acre one My Brother put it on a timer so it comes on when the Sun sets which is when the mosquitos,nats & biting flies are famous and it's a Beautiful color.Im so Happy to get this product Great Quality for Price paid & it works like a charm Safe🤗💕
customer_reviews.author: Shirley J.

customer_reviews.title: Epic Fail!  Doesn’t work as claimed
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t do anything except waste energy. I turned off the gas fired version to see if this would perform better. Nope!!!
customer_reviews.author: NyMench

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste you money if you are looking for this to help with mosquitos. The bug trap was full of moths while the mosquitos continued to devour our whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a reduction in mosquitos/noseeums
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this up for about 4-5 weeks. I’ve definitely seen a reduction of noseeums and mosquitos, but obviously not completely gone. Our backyard is pretty bad. I’d say i went from getting 11-15 bits per night to about 2-3. When we emptied the tray, there were lots of moths like other reviewers suggested, but noseeums are so small, I’d doubt you’d see them anyway. I’ve been happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Kinne

customer_reviews.title: Dynatrap to dynamite effect....... mosquitoes no more
customer_reviews.text: This model tends to light up brighter at night then the other models. It’s like a bright vacancy light for mosquito’s to fly into. I highly recommend. I’ve only had it for a week but I would like to see what effect it does after a month in service.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Spending more time outside and not annoyed by pests!
customer_reviews.text: We were not spending much time outside on our patio because of all the flying pests. This has us outside almost all the time! We have had multiple meals outside and family gatherings, none of which had any annoying flying pests around. This takes care if not just mosquitoes but also flies and gnats! Love it. Several of our family members are getting one now too!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Clark

customer_reviews.title: work for Moth only
customer_reviews.text: This is not trap Misquote trap only Moth and they will live in the net of the bottom tray until you release them and they will flight all over your head and face when you let them go.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Kinzler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it for 3 weeks and the mosquitos are gone ! It’s Unbelievable but true ! I have 1 1/2 acres and a pool and we couldn’t swim in it starting at dusk before we bought this ! Very happy so far !
customer_reviews.author: James w.

customer_reviews.title: REALLY WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: This really works! We put it up in our yard and have noticed a significant drop in the mosquito population. Last year, we couldn't sit outside in the yard starting in May due to the mosquitos. But so far this year, I haven't gotten a single bite. So glad we got this!
customer_reviews.author: Runnergirl555

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent trap. It collects all kinds of bugs
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent trap. It collects all kinds of bugs. We have not had many mosquitoes so it is hard to judge what it is going to do with them.But if what is has been doing with bugs then it should be just fine. Just make sure you leave it on all the time as it needs to work through a breeding cycle.
customer_reviews.author: NealF

customer_reviews.title: Not sure of the hype
customer_reviews.text: It's been 2.5 weeks running and the basket is maybe 1/4 full. Mostly with moths but other bugs including mosquito's which is main reason why I bought it. There are TONS of mosquito's near the house still. Will all that fresh meat nearby, I would have expected to be cleaning out the basket often. The literature does say to give it 4-6 weeks, but I'm spraying Cutter on the lawn since I can't wait for summer to be over. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: matthew pefley

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical like all of my purchases but most reviews on this were good. I can attest that I have it in my back yard and there are probably 100+ mosquitoes, 50 no-see-ums, and a few moths within the first 18 hours of turning it on. I just got it, so cannot comment on durability and the like. In my opinion worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with a defective bulb - and without a bulb it is useless. The manufacturer has no bulb in stock for this model and the bulbs are no longer available. Tried other sources for the bulb, all say the bulb is out of stock and no longer avaiulable. JUST SAVE YOUR MONEY and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built
customer_reviews.text: Nice product - well made, not sure of impact on mosquitoes but it does catch a lot of bugs, this one uses a fluorescent bulb, newer models use LED which I would recommend as need to change bulb every 5-10 years vs 5-6 months.
customer_reviews.author: UFUM

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well for mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: We bought this insect trap based on a recommendation from a family member. If you have a moth problem this works very well. If it is mosquitoes you are looking to trap, you will be very disappointed. We’ve been using it now for almost two months without turning it off. Not worth buying if you are looking to decrease your mosquito population.
customer_reviews.author: PMNH

customer_reviews.title: Fan stopped working. There are no replacement parts available.
customer_reviews.text: The thing were great for about a year-and-a-half. The cost of this item though, I would expect to get at least two years out of it. I'm pretty handy so I went online and looked for a replacement fan so that I could swap it out and I have learned that there are no replacement parts for this model available. I'm very disappointed because I should have some better support than that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs didn’t work right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty excited to see how this trap would work. I bought a water rated extension cord, cord cover, created metal, and made hangers for the tree branch. I set it all up and turned it on. Guess what? No lights. People are complaining how their bulbs are going out about a month or two months early. My didn’t even make it out of the box. Very disappointed. Got refund the same day.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Ciccarello

customer_reviews.title: Great at taking care of those little bugs that drive you crazy.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bug catcher. It does not kill the bugs right away, it traps them in the bottom. Which is great when you dont want to hear a bug zapper going off all night. I do suggest making sure it is NO WHERE near where you are going to be sitting (the instructions explain) because they really are drawn to this thing and it can get annoying. I've had to move mine a couple of times to get the desired results. But it's GREAT! I am already looking in to getting one for my parents for their pool this year.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H

customer_reviews.title: Did not trap a single insect
customer_reviews.text: A TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY.Threw it in the garbage after a couple of months.Didn't need to even clean it since there was NOT A SINGLE INSECT in it.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Plug it and leave it! I don't put it too far away. 20'-25'. I feel like a catcher at home plate. Wasp, no-see-ems, mainly mosquitos. It blew over in a bad storm. Picked it up (worried) cleaned it up. Plugged in - BACK IN BUSINESS! I live on the waterfront. It's a great value to me. Wish it had a handle so I could lock it up in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: trackandot

customer_reviews.title: this has allowed me to spend time outside using the beautiful backyard my husband has created
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't go out into the back yard for 5 minutes without getting eaten alive by swarms of mosquitos, I never see any anymore, this has allowed me to spend time outside using the beautiful backyard my husband has created.... priceless
customer_reviews.author: P. Raney

customer_reviews.title: Not a 100%, but I am in Florida
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to say how much this product helps. I have been using it for several months now. There are bugs in there for sure but never enough where I have had to dump it out yet. I definitely still have lots of mosquitoes, but I live in Florida where it is raining a lot and also by a river. So I will keep on using it but it’s not a 100% answer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Terrilynnhudson

customer_reviews.title: Seriously works!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 to put on either end of our property lines. Really helps cut down on flying pests but you have to remember to dump out the casualties. It would be great if it could run on battery otherwise you have extension cords running through your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Cord Kelly

customer_reviews.title: IT works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this a couple of months now. My friend bought it and recommended it to me. I live on the lake, in a tree covered lot. Lots of bugs all the time. Right now is the worst time of year with a lot of rain and I have to empty the tray on this weekly it gets so full. Yes I still have a few bugs not nearly what I had before. I've recommended it to all my neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Bobi Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product!! I will purchase a second one for next summer to extend the area.... they did not include deer flies in the ad.... it gets deer flies like you wouldn’t believe!! They came to it before I even got it plugged in and in seconds there was a large amount going in it!! I have two and this is my third year using them. I only cut them off for the months of February and march
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Absolutely no mosquito bites this season at all. We are in wooded country where mosquitos are rampant. This is incredible. We still have wasps and hornets and horseflies, but not to the extent we normally do.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: We bought this product hoping it would take care of ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product hoping it would take care of the mosquito problem in our yard that keeps us from enjoying our backyard. While it has attracted many different kinds of bugs, we are still plagued with mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: pfisher24

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work for mosquitoes AT ALL, and definitely doesn't cover an acre like it advertises. The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because it does catch some insects, just not what it promises.
customer_reviews.author: Katie K.

customer_reviews.title: " yet the screen material used in the trap area is not fine enough to actually keep no-see-ums inside the trap
customer_reviews.text: This trap works alright so far here in Florida. The box it comes in specifically says it works for "no-see-ums," yet the screen material used in the trap area is not fine enough to actually keep no-see-ums inside the trap. We've added a finer screen material ourselves which seems to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fingers crossed
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems to be killing mosquitoes. Quite a few in the bottom. Delivery was early and that always makes me happy. Its huge!!! Way bigger than i thought! Lol
customer_reviews.author: shayco

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made and arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: It arrived broken. The fan and the light wouldn’t turn on when I plugged it in. My husband is pretty handy and took it apart. There were some loose wires that he reassembled and was able to get it working. Now it’s definitely catching bugs but it’s still unclear if it’s impacting mosquitos. This is very cheaply made for being a few hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: ashleybk

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Worked well as long as you use an attractant. A pain to clean but was worth it
customer_reviews.author: Mariah N.

customer_reviews.title: Works on moths and some mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 65 days straight, then the bulb went out. Manufacturer does not carry a replacement bulb and neither do any online or brick-n-mortar stores (as of this date). When it was working, it killed thousands of moths and tens of mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: The video says it all!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver. We have emptied it out multiple times and look how many bugs are in there!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron and Samantha Burns

customer_reviews.title: Be quick and diligent.
customer_reviews.text: The product hasn't worked from day one and I was promised a replacement by Dynatrap...nothing. Still working on a solution but, my "return window has closed." Not cool.
customer_reviews.author: LLM56AKGirl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product !!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. My wife has yet to receive one mosquito bite while sitting on the patio while we have our Dynatrap running !!! Highly recommend !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t deserve any stars. Lasted 2 an a half months. Don’t wast your money trust me this thing is cheaply made and it complete junk!! Also went thru 3 bulbs in that time. Really got screwed on this thing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really does not work
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing hanging in my back yard for 90 days and it has collected so few insects. I live on a marsh on the Ashley River and trust me we have mosquitos. Its just my trap does not.
customer_reviews.author: Rick P.

customer_reviews.title: Summary - works pretty well, seems to catch mosquitos although not sure ...
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally wrote the review for this under a different product (axis 360). Summary - works pretty well, seems to catch mosquitos although not sure if CO2 production is really happening. Bulb didn't last 2 months, not the advertised 4. Bulbs much cheaper than propane though, and I expect this to be much more reliable than the Mosquito magnet it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Electronics addict

customer_reviews.title: No replacement bulbs available
customer_reviews.text: We initially loved this product until we tried to get replacement bulbs only after two months of use. I called Dynatrap and the lady was not helpful and stated they are out of stock. How do you sell a product that requires bulbs and not have replacement bulbs available. She didn’t really seem to care and had zero solution for me other than I had to wait until they were in stock. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Van Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Best bug repellent device made!
customer_reviews.text: This device does everything that it says it will do and then some. We live in South Dakota and after a snowy winter and a very wet spring/summer and early fall we could not enjoy our outdoor living space at all until we purchased one of the Dynatraps. Now I can't wait until this spring and summmer!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky B.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This product definitely does its job in moths. But as for mosquitos, June bugs, and flies our good old fashioned bug zapper works much better!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to pull the trigger and give Dyna Trap a shot. I got it late this year, but it has killed it's share of mosquitos and moths.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Deubler

customer_reviews.title: Hey...that's pretty good!
customer_reviews.text: I placed it at a distance of about 20 feet from the house as recommended so as to be away from house light sources, and it definitely catches some mosquitoes, but not all. Of course, I am on the MS coast near two rivers and I wasn't really expecting it to catch all. 4 months of operation so far without issue.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Got it just in time (March), i've been having ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it just in time (March), i've been having back yard cookouts, not ONE mosquito bite for anyone! Also, I used the chemical attractant, the combo has been unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Loremaster

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I hung it up in mid May and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I hung it up in mid May and it is now July 10th and we haven't been bit at all this year. That is really saying alot since we live in a heavily wooded area with a small lake about 100 yards away. Last year we couldn't step outside without a heavy layer of OFF, now we don't even think about mosquitoes. The pictures are a bit misleading, this thing is huge. I was expecting lantern sized, but it was 3 times as big.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A Canavan

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money if you need to control mosquitoes. It catches ever other flying insect. Not mosquitoes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blown away
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually starting to worry that I'm ruining the environment. This thing is a bug magnet. I have it at my campground and I am wiping out huge piles of bugs. I'm wonder if at some point does it work to good ?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gemaly

customer_reviews.title: Noticeably less
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Dynatrap for about 6 weeks now. It does trap a lot of moths! Haven't seen many mosquitoes in trap but I will say something's happened because there is noticeably less mosquitoes! We'll keep it but wish it wasn't $145
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bottom “catcher” was broken upon arrival but I think I can fix. Not a big enough deal to return. With Dayna-trap was as easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Topper

customer_reviews.title: It catches many moths and other flying insects, but ...
customer_reviews.text: It catches many moths and other flying insects, but has yet to reduce the mosquito population in my yard. It is large and produces a bright blue glow at night. I have found a few mosquitoes in the trap, but only a dozen over a 3 week period. I deem this not an effective product for southern Oregon.
customer_reviews.author: Chadd Smith

customer_reviews.title: It works! Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on reviews and information. Although it does seem to work, I have not seen evidence that it covers the area stated. I got the 1 acre model for a 1/4 acre yard, thinking this would certainly wipe out the bugs. However, it only seems to work well in about a 50 ft radius. I will continue to adjust location for better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kirkland

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but...
customer_reviews.text: This unit out of the box is great, insects flocked to it like a magnet first day the there were so many moths and .... However depending on the insect they won't die in 24hrs, Wondering if I can spray insect spray through the cage.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: One week of the dynatrap (second week having it)!!!! I'd say it's more than a fancy night light! Doesn't completely get rid of bugs obviously but it decreases all flying pests majorly!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Working great after only a day
customer_reviews.text: I set these up last night, and despite the high winds, there's already 50 or so in each trap. I put the octenol lures in today, so I expect they'll perform even better. Just a note that there's an on /off switch hiding in the lid by where the power cord goes in. It's inside a rubber weatherproof covering, so it's easy to miss.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: Working well, but only limited trapping of mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: Working exactly as expected. I find some mosquitos in the trap, but not nearly as many as we would like. I’m sure it’s helping some though. We only had this in use a few weeks, so let’s see how the hot part of summer goes.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy and Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: This has drastically reduced the number of mosquitos in the vicinity of my porch. I used to struggle with keeping them at bay with candles and insect-repellant incense, but now I don't have to deal with them at all. There are still a few mosquitos around, but barely noticeable. Also, the box claims it won't catch moths, but it definitely catches a few, along with a couple of other random bugs. The vast majority are the mosquitos, though.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Bulb didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a little over 3 months and the bugs keep coming. Unfortunately, it’s mostly moths and bugs that never bothered me. The goal was for mosquitoes and I continue to get bitten when I briefly go outside. The bulb has already gone out which is extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's BIG and never caught a mosquito
customer_reviews.text: If you want something gigantic (carefully read the description and look at the dimensions) it's not compact or small by any means. It caught many flying bugs but not the one flying bug I was hoping for, the Mosquito. Returned this back to amazon and will look for something else to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Alberico

customer_reviews.title: Bulb burn out 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Light bulb burned out after 6 weeks. Worked great until then. For the price , I expected it to last longer. I submitted a ticket on dyna trap website customer service. No response
customer_reviews.author: Mrs S

customer_reviews.title: The catching wholes are too small
customer_reviews.text: The wholes are two small for Arizona giant mosquitos. I would add a picture but it doesn't let me.
customer_reviews.author: Iveth Villalobos

customer_reviews.title: Yellow flies too
customer_reviews.text: Although they don't list yellow flies as one of the insects it will trap, believe me, this machine does get them too ... this year has been one of the worst ever for yellow flies in North Florida, and this does trap a bunch of them every night. It won't get all of them but it certainly helps a lot ... well worth the $$$ ... also a great company if you need customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jon A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money, won’t work for mosquitos at all. Used it for a full season, didn’t see any changes
customer_reviews.author: Alyona

customer_reviews.title: No Mo Skeeters!
customer_reviews.text: This machine has taken care of our backyard mosquito problem. No mosquitos even at dusk. Have been able to enjoy our evenings in the pool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: All I have to say is wow! This product has been on my back porch for less than 24hra and I have already dumped it twice. It is extremely quite and effective. Worth every penny! Also, I purchased this 2 days ago and it shipped out that day. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon H.

customer_reviews.title: Does it work on flies?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trap specifically to address the flies in my horse area. I bought the one acre model. It does work on lots of bugs but it doesn’t seem to catch flies, which is why I bought it. I will keep using it since it does catch other annoying bugs. But if anybody could share on getting it to work on flies I’d appreciate suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: like it says it will do
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this with the hope we could cut down on the flies and mosquitoes... like it says it will do! Well it catches the moths and NOT THE MOSQUITOES OR FLIES. It's nice to have the moths gone but I did want the mosquitoes and flies gone too. :(
customer_reviews.author: MaryStix

product_meta.title: DynaTrap DT1775 Insect Trap AtraktaGlo Light, 1 Acre, Black
product_meta.description: Size:1 AcreCatch more flying insects with the DynaTrap DT1775 Insect Trap. Proven to attract, trap, and kill mosquitoes, biting flies, wasps, hornets, yellow jackets, moths, and more, this trap’s three-way system lures flying insects with a powerful AtraktaGlo UV light and carbon dioxide. The trap's whisper-quiet fan traps insects in the screened base until they dehydrate and die--without the use of harmful chemicals or pesticides. Designed for use in all weather conditions, this mosquito trap offers extended range of up to 1 acre.
feature_bullets: 3-way protection against mosquitoes and other flying insects
Ultra-bright AtraktaGlo light and light-enhancing diffuser attracts insects
Whisper-quiet fan attracts insects without zapping or buzzing
Extended coverage up to 1 acre; durable all-weather insect trap for use indoors and outdoors; plugs into standard 110-volt outlet
Mosquito trap uses no pesticides or chemicals; requires no attractant or propane
Needs at least 3 weeks to trap enough mosquitoes to make an impact, and 6 weeks to break the breeding cycle

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars495 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
